entry.title: Electriquette (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Electriquette (example pictured) was an electric wicker vehicle that could be rented at the 1915 Panama–California Exposition?

entry.title: Tokamak de Fontenay-aux-Roses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that shortly after it was completed, the Tokamak de Fontenay-aux-Roses burned a hole through itself in a plasma disruption?

entry.title: Józef Ignacy Kraszewski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 19th-century Polish writer Józef Ignacy Kraszewski authored hundreds of works, including more than 200 novels?

entry.title: abortion in Benin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the legalization of abortion in Benin was supported by two members of the cabinet who had both worked as gynecologists?

entry.title: Alex Chilowicz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in December 2023, former Major League Soccer referee Alex Chilowicz began officiating in the English Football League after relocating to England?

entry.title: Marmelada de Santa Luzia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that many producers of Marmelada de Santa Luzia, a variety of quince cheese, are descendants of quilombolas?

entry.title: Nathaniel Coe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nathaniel Coe declined nomination to the United States Senate, instead choosing to serve as an inspector for the United States Postal Service?

entry.title: Cosmetic Playlover (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sachi Narashima came up with the idea for the manga Cosmetic Playlover after her friend, who worked as a beauty consultant, mentioned that there were male beauty consultants?

entry.title: Mary Jo West (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Jo West compared working in network TV news to learning that Santa Claus is just an ordinary man?
